definition: to fall/to drop/to lag behind/to lose/to go missing/to reduce/fall (in prices)/to lose (value, weight etc)/to wag/to swing/to turn/to change/to exchange/to swap/to show off/to shed (hair)/(used after certain verbs to express completion, fulfillment, removal etc)
to exchange/to change (clothes etc)/to substitute/to switch/to convert (currency)

sentences.english: Why did you change my thing in my medicine bag?
sentences.chinese: 为什么你掉换了我包里的东西？

sentences.english: He replaced the worn type with a new one.
sentences.chinese: 他把那些磨损的轮胎替掉换上新的。

sentences.english: Products forming the subject of complaints shall be replaced in the vehicle by new parts.
sentences.chinese: 引起索赔的产品应用新的零部件在车辆中进行掉换。

definition: lit. to steal a rafter and replace it with a column/to replace the original with a fake/to perpetrate a fraud (idiom)
to steal sb's valuable item and substitute a similar-looking but worthless item/to sell a fake for the genuine article/to palm off
lit. to lead away a goat while passing by (idiom)/fig. to opportunistically pocket sb's possessions and walk off
to repay a debt in kind or by labor
to resell at a profit/to speculate
to repay a debt in kind or by labor
to take for one's own/to expropriate
to make more of the same thing/to reproduce/to reprocess/to remanufacture
